title: Who am I?
text: Leo, based at the Plateau de Saclay since September 2020, and won’t leave before October 2027 (at least).

title: What’s my name
text: Hello, my name is Leo

title: What’s my name
text:
Doctorant INRAE
Sujet : Modélisation stochastique et déterministe de contrôle de populations d’insectes par lâchers de mâles stériles - Applications en agro-écologie et épidémiologie
Encadré par Camille Coron et Luis Almeida

title: Research
text:
Subject: Stochastic and deterministic modeling of insect population control by sterile males releasing - Applications in agro-ecology and epidemiology.
Started on October 2024.
Supervisors: Camille Coron and Luis Almeida.



I aim to understand the dynamics of mosquito populations, with properties such as extinction, reemergence, and the impact of environmental factors on the population dynamics. Specifically, I focus on the Aedes genus, using real-world data.
I use mathematical tools such as branching processes, stochastic compartmental models and their limiting behavior, such as deterministic systems and stochastic diffusion.

title: Leo Micollet
text:
I am currently pursuing a PhD in applied mathematics, specializing in the stochastic and deterministic modeling of population dynamics and control strategies.
I am a part of the MIA-PS team at INRAE in Saclay.
For now, this website is empty. Restez branché.

title: Who am I?
text:
What do I like?
Adventure Time, Stochastic Calculus, and Mosquitoes.

title: Teachings
text:
Teaching Assistant for Statistics (33 hours) for first-year students at AgroParisTech.
Teaching Assistant for the course “Data Science: Statistical Learning” (7.5 hours) for second-year students at AgroParisTech.

title: Who am I ?
text:
Where I’m from ?

Engineer from ENSTA Paris with a research M2 from Université Paris Saclay (M2 MSV- Mathematics for Life Science).
Prépa TSI at Lazaristes.
Bac STI2D, c la débrouille.

title: Who am I?
text:
Where am I from?

Engineering degree from ENSTA Paris, promo 2023.5, with a research Master’s (M2 MSV - Mathematics for Life Sciences) from Université Paris Saclay and Institut Polytechnique de Paris.
CPGE TSI at Lazaristes.

I aim to understand the dynamics of mosquito populations, with properties such as extinction, reemergence, and the impact of environmental factors on the population dynamics. Specifically, I focus on the Aedes genus, using real-world data.
I use mathematical tools such as branching processes, stochastic compartmental models and their limiting behavior, such as deterministic systems and stochastic diffusion.

title: Blog
text: Academic Year 2025-2026

title: Just a test post
text:
Let’s start with a glorious mosquito pic from Wikipedia






Figure 1: Mosquito from Wikipedia





This is just to check the possibilities in pages. The goal is to talk about math of course, but also historical and biological aspects. I need to write math(see Equation 1), but also code (see Listing 1) and include images (see Figure 1).
For instance, a beautiful integral using Point measure: \[
\int_{\mathbb{R}^d}\int_{\mathbb{R_+}} \mathbb{1}_{\lambda(x)\leq \theta} \, dN(\theta,x) = 1
\tag{1}\]
And a little bit of python code, just to check if it can work:




Listing 1: can the world see me ?


print("hello world")




hello world


The code is working, thx Julian !
